channel.title: Durian on Gerald Nguyen
channel.description: Recent content in Durian on Gerald Nguyen

item.title: Thailand imported durian from Vietnam. What happened?
item.description:
Vietnam’s Tuoitre newspaper reported that Thailand paid 97 million USD to import fruit and vegetables from Vietnam. At the top of the import list is durian.

That was unthinkable in the past!

Thailand used to have all of China’s durian imports up until 2021 but dropped to 61% in 2023, according to another Vietnamese paper. Vietnam’s fresh durian export to China, starting from July 2022, was the reason for the drop. Favorable weather, large plantations, proximity, and year-round harvest of durian were major advantages that have so far powered Vietnam’s ascension on the durian power scale.

item.title: Southeast Asia Durian Paradises
item.description:
In Southeast Asia, durian is often referred to as the “king of fruits,” and it has a long history of being enjoyed by locals and visitors alike. It is commonly consumed fresh, although it is also used in various dishes such as ice cream, cakes, and candy.

Durian is also a significant agricultural crop in Southeast Asia, and many farmers rely on it as a source of income. The fruit is typically harvested in the late afternoon or early evening, and it is then transported to markets and sold within a day or two.
